730235f-a.title: General view - [Manhattan - 22nd Street - 2nd Avenue (Northeast).]
730235f-a.text:
A general view, northeast, from the S.E. corner of Second Ave.,  and 22nd Street.
September 3, 1929.
P. L. Sperr.

711595f-a.text:
Epiphany School, 236 East 22nd Street, south side, just west of Second Avenue.  The church steeple at the left is that of the Roman Catholic Church of the Epiphany.

September 3, 1929

P.L. Sperr.

September 3, 1929.

711594f-a.text:
East 22nd Street at the N.W. corner of Second Ave.  Shown across clearance is the rears of the buildings on East 23rd Street at the S.W. corner of Second Ave.

September 1, 1929.

P.L. Sperr

707802f-a.text:
382-388 and 392 Second Ave., at and adjoining the N.E. corner of East 22nd Street, showing at the corner a 5-story loft building, built in 1880, upon the site of the former "Union Steam Works;" the scene of a pitched battle during the Draft Riots of the Civil War.
September 1937.
George D. Chinn.
